Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: HappytravellerOslo
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice by the airport bus. The hotel was a 10-15 minute walk from the bus station, you just walk straight ahead, over a small bridge, and then you have it on your left hand side; easy to miss, but just look up, and you'll see the sign. We'd booked the suite. The room was alright, but when you book something called a "suite", you probably expect more. A coat of paint would have done a lot for the room, along with some logic in the light switches. But the expectations were saved by the size of the room and the view. The staff was nice, and the breakfast alright for a country that isn't exactly known for its breakfast habits. The location was absolutely perfect, "close" to everything (depending on how many times you get lost in the narrow streets of Venice). If I ever go back to Venice, I will probably stay at La Forcola again!

Reviews.Title: “Love Cannaregio!”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen37
Reviews.Content: I had the single room (with double bed) with the small balcony. It was (unseasonally but wonderful!) boiling hot during my stay and the balcony, which looked out to rooftops was excellent, as the room was really hot due to AC not being turned on. Sitting out on the balcony with a cold prosecco was lovely. Small mini fridge also in room, and everything exceptionally clean. I love Cannaregio and this location is excellent, just a short walk from San Marcuola vap stop (over one smallish bridge)

Reviews.Title: “Very short stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: JaneCamden
Reviews.Content: I have just spent a wonderful short stay in Venice, travelling on my own and meeting up with people for a day. La Forcola met with all my expectations, it was very easy to get to from water bus, or walking from the Piazale Roma, (the express from the airport or number 5 bus will take you there). I recommend the directions on the hotel's website to help you on the first day. The rooms are small but clean and it is in a lively road with shops and cafes. Turn one way to Rialto and the other to Piazale Roma. The breakfast is continental and you can fill yourself up before you go out,the only downside was no coffee in the room, there is a minibar which I didn' t open (maybe I should have). Venice is wonderful and La Forcola makes a nice economical base to explore it from.

Reviews.Title: “50th Birthday in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tutu210362
Reviews.Content: this hotel was very well situated to use as a base, with the San Marcuola waterbus stop very nearby. The room suited our needs for the stay, and we found the hotel a pleasant place to stay in. The staff were courteous and helpful, and the rooms were kept well. Breakfasts were good and gave us a good start to the day.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional but not spacious”
Reviews.Author: BillandSueEssex
Reviews.Content: As with all our reviews lets look at the good and not so good sides: Firstly the the problem with many of the hotels in Venice is also the appeal. The large majority of hotels are built in very old and cramped buildings and as a consequence space is of a premium. You will be able to 'swing a cat' but not much more. The space available, means space in the bedroom is at a premium and even more so in the bathroom. The staff are not unpleasant or unhelpful but not do they create a overwhelming air of welcome. They are polite and helpful but not outstanding. The breakfast is typically European; cereals, croissants, bread rolls, jams and coffee and they are all fresh, but that's the choice. Ok so I guess that's the negative side. On the positive side, the rooms were nicely appointed, clean and small but not tiny. We had a room on the third floor that looked directly down one of the canals, so no complaints on the view. We had friends staying on the same floor who also had a balcony. The bathroom was small but held a toilet, basin, bidet and small but powerful shower and all were spotlessly clean. All in all once you accept the size of the rooms, they were comfortable and perfectly adequate for two travelling adults. What makes this hotel worth while? Location and and value. You're not going to break the bank and it's in a great location; neither too busy nor too far off the beaten track. Coming from the airport take the water bus orange line and dis-embark at the Pont de Guglie, you'e about 5-10 ten minute walk away. We most certainly recommend this hotel, and would stay again. Venice is a fantastic city and you could do a lot worse than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “good value & location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kman773
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel to be located nicely on a small canal stop & within 5-10 minutes walking distance from the train station. The place is small and cozy but decorated up to to date. The staff was friendly and spoke English well, Only 23 rooms. I booked for solo and found my room to be typical small for Europe, but well situated with a TV, WiFi, minibar, and a walk out balcony! ( my view was of a courtyard but nice either way) Free breakfast was a typical cont-style and very good. Also, by the way, my bed was exceptionally comfortable. Everything you want to see is nearby, its location and price make it a good stay for any traveller.

Reviews.Title: “One Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: RetiredSKI
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on route to a cruise. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable, but beware of the bath. I stepped into the bath to find that the bottom was not flat, but shaped to accommodate the shower. I slipped, and it could have ended our holiday there and then! however it didn't,and we had a good afternoon and evening exploring that part of Venice.It is well located with a waterbus stop not many minutes away. The breakfast buffet was very good with plenty of variety. Our luggage was looked after while we spent the morning out before joining the cruise early afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for busy and expensive Venice.”
Reviews.Author: Autumn L
Reviews.Content: It wasn't the Ritz, but that wasn't what I was paying for, nor did I expect. For a tourist friendly weekend, I paid $226 for two nights. In that town, that's not bad. The room was small, but it had everything I needed. The remote for the TV didn't work, but in a small room, that was no problem. I had a nice bathroom, clean bed, mini-bar and a balcony. The view wasn't spectacular, but the proximity to the vaparetto more than made up for it. The neighborhood was lively, had lots of shops and felt safe when walking in the late evenings. The breakfast was typically European and the wonderful smell of pasteries wafted through the hall in the mornings (it was included in the price). For anyone traveling on a budget with reasonable expectations, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: Dean S
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite adequate, quaint and in a reasonable location. Our room was small, but had a view down a canal. Although the room was quite close to the street and the main thoroughfare, when the windows were closed you could not tell, very quiet. The bathroom was very small and needed some repair, but was quite adequate for our needs. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast was a little simple, some fresh fruit would have helped, especially as there is a fruit stall across the lane.

Reviews.Title: “this time bad experience”
Reviews.Author: LilyRH
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the La Forcola hotel some years ago and I had been pretty happy of my stay then. This time my stay was not so good. I originally booked a standard room and when I got in the room was so small that there was hardly any room between the end of the bed and the wall to pass. We had 2 suitcases and 2 carry-on bags with us and there was absolutely no space where to put them. Even if we had tried to put the suitcases along the wall, we would have had to jump over the bed to go on the other side of the room. Plus the room was dark and looked over a wall, basically an Anna Frank view.... So I called the front desk and asked to be given a larger room. I was told there would have been a supplement of 20 euros for a superior room. Ok fine, what could we do? The new room was more spacious, it had an entrance where we could put the suitcases and there was actually room to go around, but when I got into the bathroom another bad surprise: there was no shower cabin: just a shower head. No shower curtain or dish.No soap dish either, so we had to put the soap on the window sill and the shampoo bottles on the toilet lid. Whenever we would take a shower the whole bathroom flooded. Water everywhere, on the toilet, on the bidet, on the floor. In order not to slip and fall we had to put the bath towels on the floor. How can it be possible that a 3-star hotel has a bathroom with no shower cabin or even a curtain? Last time I had gotten a room with a shower cabin, and this room that allegedly was a "superior" room had not even a curtain. Luckily we stayed just one night at this hotel but I will never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Deidra S
Reviews.Content: While the staff was friendly, we did not get breakfast as we had to leave before they served breakfast. The location was good but the room was not worth it. We stayed in many hostels that were far better!! The room was dark and so musky, when you walked into the bathroom, the source of the musky smell was apparent. Along the top of 2 walls and on the ceiling was very large portions of black mold! Both ended up sick after one night of staying here!! Will not ever stay here again. Will find a hostel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at good price”
Reviews.Author: PeterJK_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the budget traveller. Great Location and easy to reach. We had 2 rooms. One was small but above average (Canal View) and other one huge (superior) - I would suggest the latter. Breakfast was basic but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Some positives Some Negatives”
Reviews.Author: jaqs21
Reviews.Content: Location: Good, close to Rialto and 10 min walk to the train station and st marks square.. Approx 3 minute from the water bus stop.. Good choice of food and a delicious fruit shop across the road. Rooms: Were great but were lucky and stayed in one of the renovated room which was lovely.. Very Clean and comfy Staff: The night man was lovely and nothing was too much trouble. The gorgeous day guy was extremely lazy and when asking him to book tours or to get the internet he kept telling us to come back later.. Breakfast: Pretty Average Air con didnt work If you can get for a decend price it is worth staying here

Reviews.Title: “Very Average but good location”
Reviews.Author: Danielle M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on our honeymoon. We thought the location was really good, easy walking distance to st marks square and good shopping nearby but we were disappointed with the hotel itself. The staff weren't very friendly and seemed grumpy all the time! We paid extra and got a canal view room and the view was nice but the room was nothing special. The bed was 2 singles pushed together and uncomfortable and the bathroom was dirty and tiny, we even saw a cockroach or 2 running on the floor!! Breakfast was basic but not bad and the coffee was good. I don't think we would come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth staying in”
Reviews.Author: smurf99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days. It had to be the worst hotel we stayed in. The rooms were bad, the hotel staff very unfriendly and not helpful at all. The breakfast was terrible and very basic. The only positive about this hotel was that is was a 10 minute walk from the main train station. There were better hotels in the area at much better prices. Too far from San Marco's Square. Avoid this hotel. The hotel staff needs training on how to interact with tourists. Definitely will not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I finally found my hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Gordana_Z
Reviews.Content: Nice location. All kinds of good restaurants and conveniences nearby (i.e. great pharmacy). Walking distance to St. Mark's (faster than taking vaporeto). Standard size room and bathtub for Europe. Beds are on the small side but new and very comfortable (even for people with back trouble who are very picky about mattresses). Rooms are quite clean. Really, excellent overall compared to other hotels in Venice at this price level. The staff was very helpful, poised and sophisticated. All you can eat classical European breakfast. Maybe North Americans expect everything to be bigger, but this is really a very fine European hotel for that price. In any case, I have finally found my hotel in Venice and will stay there next time I go there. Gordana

Reviews.Title: “Not again”
Reviews.Author: Loboli2
Reviews.Content: Location was OK, but the room, even for Venice, was incredibly small and the bathroom was filthy with shower doors missing and mildew all around. No direct connection to water taxis...hard to get to with heavy luggage. Poor breakfast...but Venice was nice.

Reviews.Title: “If you wish to have a pleasant stay in venice-dont pick up this hotel”
Reviews.Author: angela97
Reviews.Content: I stay in La Forcola Hotel in Venice for 4 days/3 nights.Before making a reservation i checked the website of the hotel but in reality the situation was much different.I could say it was a disaster. The staff is unfriendly and rude.The room is unbearably small, the bed is short and tiny!They dont clean the room every day and the breakfast ispoor.It was a nightmare!Just dont go there! It turned out that the rudest and most impolite italian worked there.The only person who deserves congratulations is the guy from Bangladesh who works as a receptionist during the night.They spoiled my mood in beautiful Venice.I will not recommend this hotel to anybody.I will try to share my bad experience with my friends and warn them.I will not come back there again!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: normav53
Reviews.Content: Booked a late deal with Global Holidays for 3 nts less than Â£200 - hotel in a perfect location. Emailed them first for a room with a balcony and were given the largest balcony in the hotel. Breakfast typical continental. Stayed near St. Marks before but this hotel was in a more convenient area. 15 mins walk to the bus station or short water bus ride. Print off hotel details for directions how to get from station. Check out the osterias down the back alleys for cheap (but excellent) food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “Could be a great hotel if.......”
Reviews.Author: hynds1797
Reviews.Content: I am not going to pick on the little things and show pictures of the inperfections. Our room had a few problems and I observed another guest asking to switch rooms because his shower sprung a leak and was showering the hallway. It's Europe and unless you want to pay $500 a night you deal with the small stuff. Generally a nice clean hotel with most things working. Nice location and good views if you have a balcony. Balcony in 206 is too small to sit on but nice to stand outside and look around. One balcony over the street and one over the canal. The staff was not very helpful and made for a less than great stay considering the $200 a night US price tag. We ended up having a running joke about the mean breakfast lady that seamed to be angry that all these customers were messing up her breakfast area. We were kind of scared of her, afraid to go back for seconds. Breakfast was weak at best, we had better at our two prior stays in Rome and Sorrento (rooms at half the price). My complaints: $10 E for 24 hours of WiFi that you could only conect if you are sitting in the lobby (were I am right now). Free in most hotels in your room. Asked if we could leave one day early and not be charged (we reserved three days). We watched them turn serveral walk ins away because they were full but if we wanted to stay two nights we would still have to pay for three (even though we tried to give about 36 hours notice). No cancellation policy posted. I would probably stay elsewhere given a second go at it.

Reviews.Title: “Hardest beds and pillows”
Reviews.Author: DixonCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Venice and if this hotel is a representation of the quality of hotels in the $200 a night range I will stay across the bridge next time. The ambiance is just "old". The only other postive things are that the staff is mostly patient, speak good English and the location is fair-- 15 min walk from the train. The beds, pillows and linens were very old. The mattresses were very hard and the pillows did not bend. Wake up calls didn't happen. There was a pidgeon nesting in the bathroom window and the window sill was in disrepair. TV has no English channels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: leejasmith
Reviews.Content: We arrived at La Forcola for a 3 night stay and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff were friendly and the rooms were generously sized. Breakfast was simple with cereals and pastries but this was exactly what was needed to get you going in a morning. We had a slight problem with water leaking from the Air conditioning vent but we were moved to another room on the same floor with 2 balconies. All in all I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice small and cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: dzarimis
Reviews.Content: We spend two nights at this small hotel. The room and bathroom were small but we didn't care a lot since we visited the room only to take a shower and sleep. The breakfast was average but ok. The hotel looked to be refurbished recently, and even though it was situated on a main street it was quiet enough due to double glazing. 15 minutes walking distance from Rialto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “For the perfect impression of Venice - Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: pablohooney1981
Reviews.Content: I proposed to my girlfriend this weekend, so naturally I wanted everything to be perfect. I must have scoured over 100 hotels on tripadvisor, looking for somewhere that offered the perfect balance of being picturesque, romantic, and gave my girlfriend (who had never been to Venice) the perfect impression of why Venice (to me) is the most romatic city in the world. This weekend meant everything to me, and I wanted it to mean everything to her. La Forcola did not disappoint! From the pictures on Tripadvisor, it quickly becomes apparent that all hotels in Venice have quite small rooms (it is the style of the city), so people who complain about room sizes have a lot of misconceptions about what is available in Venice. The room in this context is perfectly sized. Most Venetian hotels pride themselves on Venetian styled decor. I personally find thhis style a bit gaudy, an La Forcola is a perfect alternative. The rooms have a baeutiful finish to them, and are perfectly clean. The bathroom had not a trace of damp, which is often a problem in Venice. I paid slightly extra for a double room out of all the options available to me, in the hope that I would be allocated the room which is pictured. To my delight when we arrived, I found out that I had indeed been lucky enough to have been allocated the room I had fallen in love with on the website. Our room was on the second floor, in the corner, and as a result had two balconies - the first above the entrance of the hotel and looking down onto the little bridge over the canal and onto the street below, which is beautifully busy, and you can people watch and enjoy the gentle burbur of the people walking by below through all the little shops. The second balcony overlooks the canal which the little bridge crosses, and therefore, depending on which romantic scene you prefer, you can watch the hussle and bustle below, or the water and the boats. I was slightly concerned the noise from the street might be intrusive, but not a bit of it, it was a lovely happy people noise, and never loud - and even if it were, both balconies had double glazing which effectively shut out any noise from outside. The staff were friendly and polite (staff rudeness at other hotels seems to be the biggest complaint for Venetian hotels) and there was never any noise from any of the other guests. The hotel is a beautiful picuresque setting, with elegant decor within and is very well run. It is a short enjoyable walk from all the places of interest, but has enjoyable surroundings on its doorstep. This weekend went perfectly, and I was able to make my new Fiancee very happy this weekend, and I owe a huge portion of this to how happy we were with the hotel. There will be other more grand hotels in Venice, but I could not think of a better one to stay at if you want to capture the essence and romance of Venice. The room I booked with both balconies was room 206 and I booked it as a Double Superior room if you also wish to have the room that is featured. If anything about this hotels information has left you with doubts, ignore them - this is a fantastic little hotel and punches well above its 3 star rating. We could not have been happier during our time here

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, but dissapointing room”
Reviews.Author: Alpacker41
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was very well positioned, only a couple minutes walk from the station. Breakfast was ok, with cereals, yogurts and fruit. However, this was the only real positive attributes about the hotel. The air conditioner in the room leaked water onto the floor and created a nice puddle right by the door. The bed was very uncomfortable as were the pillows. Luckily we did not spend too much time in the hotel. Overall while the hotel was fairly priced due to its location and breakfast, we were quite disappointed with the condition of the room.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is OK but hot room!!”
Reviews.Author: xemily18x
Reviews.Content: Overall my husband and I loved Venice we were there in May 2009. Hotel La Forcola had very trendy furniture but overall the room needed more maintenance. It was very warm, the A/C was not powerful at all we slept three hot nights there! The next day we asked for a different room and they hesitated to switch us rooms but we were able to convince them the other room was not only hot but moldy so we decided to stay in our original hot room. The location is great, the view as well. We would not stay in this hotel again unless we return in the winter and we would still hesitate to stay here. I canâ€™t say itâ€™s overall horrible because Iâ€™m sure it has nicer rooms but we were not lucky enough to get one of those rooms. The night staff is far friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, well located, great breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: sasha7778
Reviews.Content: For a mega expensive city like Venice, this hotel offers great value. It's much closer to the station than to the main attractions of Venice, but Venice is pretty small and you can walk everywhere (don't waste money on multi trip Vaporetto passes). You can easily walk with your luggage to the hotel from the station too. My room was small but adequate; the bathroom was spacious and clean - OK the shower arrangement was unusual ie water went all over the toilet and bidet but this can easily be mopped off with the bathmat. Furniture was a little aged and chipped - maybe the renovations described on the hotel's website hadn't reached room 106 - but still quite functional. there is not a lot of storage space ie one wardrobe with a few coat hangers - base of wardrobe is taken up with a safe which works (good). Breakfast was lavish and offered meusli, fruit salad (canned) and yoghurt as well as croissants, bread, jam etc. TV is useless unless you are an Italian speaker as it picks up local TV only.

Reviews.Title: “well below expectations”
Reviews.Author: fish345
Reviews.Content: Although La Forcola is located in a good area the room was extremely tiny with some mould covering the bathroom roof. There was also a leak in the roof from the air conditoner so water was dripping all day and night. The breakfast was below average as well. was disapointed considering the amount paid to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in venice”
Reviews.Author: firefly_trip
Reviews.Content: very small nice and clean. place for those who do not spend whole day in hotel.. you have everything you need around- shops,street markets,cheep pubs and snacbars, warterbus stations to any direction, casino and quietness. very nice area near the gheto. to get to san marco will take you about 10-15 minutes, but if you remember that venice isnt only san marco - you can find wonderfull places to enjoy in canaregio district. rooms are small and clean. staf - polite,quet and helpful. i"ve made the reservation by email from there website and my room was exactly as i asked including small balcony (important for smokers like me). for the same price i"ve found just hostels in venice or 3 stars hotels in mestre and murano. breacfast - simple and didnt changed even once during 8 days of my stay. but there always was what to chose. coming back there for shure :-)

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: Mi2n
Reviews.Content: The room and the bathroom in La Forcola are clean but very small. There is not enough space to move about after you keep one small suitcase on the floor. You won't be served breakfast if you check out before eight a.m, not even a cup of coffee, even though you may have requested for it the night before. Mithu the man at the reception will tell you firmly that coffee can not be organised early in the morning. But the hotel has two positive features ; an elevator, a rarity in Venice and, Ricardo the other person at the reception. Ricardo is extremely helpful. As i had already got lost twice that day, he walked with me to the water- bus station at eleven in the night only to ensure that i would be able to find my way the next day. If it hadn't been for him I would have never been able to catch my train to Florence the next morning. He mitigates to a large extent the very ordinary experience which I had at Forcola.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: latitude-longitude
Reviews.Content: Nice and cozy, clean little hotel that offers great value! My room was maybe a bit on the small side, but I found it pleasant nevertheless. The breakfast was nice (apricot crostata, yummy!) as was the service. My only negative comment was that the doors were not open 24h. I usually get up very early in the morning (for sunrise photography) and here I had to sleep a couple of hours longer than usual. But for the ordinary traveller this is no problem!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't fault this budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: emz_ing
Reviews.Content: We paid 50euro a night to stay in this hotel in low season which for venice is very cheap indeed. The hotel is located in an excellent position on a busy street that runs all the way from the bus/railway station to the rialto brige, about half way between the two. The area is vibrant with many shops bars and restaurants very close to the hotel. The room we stayed in was small but it very nice and having peeked into the other rooms they do appear to be much larger. The room itself was cleaned everyday and had a safe, tv, waredrobe and mini bar, as well as room service on request. The breakfast was basic but adequate, cereals, bread rolls, croissants, jam, fruit salad, juice and tea/coffee/hot chocolate. Check out is 11am but they are willing to hold onto your bags for the rest of the day. Overall, we could not fault this hotel. It was in a good position was cheap in price but not in experience and we would definitely stay here again. Additionally, we would recommend the Rolling Venice Card which is for 14-29 year olds and costs 4euro. With it a 72hour vaporetto (water bus) pass cost 18euro instead of 33euro and entry into doges palace and other museums are half price. You can get one from tourist information at the airport and this will also get you on the bus from the airport to the bus station where you can get on a no.1 vaporetto to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location is the thing”
Reviews.Author: jono67cyber
Reviews.Content: Good location although first room had a problem we were moved to another without a terrace really quickly without any problems. The canal views are limited but sure would be much better on the side rooms as less noise than the front on the 3rd floor as noisey street vendor. Very friendly staff helped us with directions and places to eat etc. Right in the centre of things close to Marculo Vaperretto stop and the rialto bridge not too far away. The Breakfast could have been a little better with real coffee rather than a machine specially as Italian Espresso is so good. Overall a really nice visit just needs tweaking a little and yes we also had a shower in the corner without a curtain almost a wet room but not quite. Enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough about it!”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustak
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. The year before, my first time in Venice, I stayed at the San Cassiano Residenza d' Epoca Ca' Favretto, & although that hotel gets rave reviews, I liked the Hotel La Forcola better. The room was small, but nice. Most European rooms are small anyway & I think it's part of the charm. It had hardwood floors, a twin bed, a TV, a typical bathroom, closet, & a lift. There was a nice window that opened up to a canal view. I loved looking out the window & breathing in the fresh, cool air, & dipping my head out the window & watching the canal vender boats transporting such things as vegetables. The front desk lady was French & very nice & welcoming. Big smile! When she looked at my passport & saw that it happend to be my birthday, she commented on it & exhuberantly wished me a happy birthday. The lobby of this hotel was also nice. Self service breakfast w/ a coffee machine. I really enjoyed eating breakfast there. It felt really relaxed. At the San Cassiano, I felt rushed & like there was not enough food or something. The atmosphere felt stuffy & unwelcoming. I also loved the location. A fun walk to St. Marks square & the bridge. All in all a lovely, delightful stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice view”
Reviews.Author: JeffCarter
Reviews.Content: booked through europeanvacations.com We spent 6 days touring italy with two nights at the Hotel La Forcola in Venice. The room was nice and the view from both sides of the room were great. The bathroom was a little odd. Th eshower was just a corner of the bathroom with no shower curtains or doors - very strange. The other travelers with us had a bathtub, but all of us had a slight mold/mildew problem. It appears this is common throughout the city and it really did not bother us. The free continental breakfast was comparable to the other hotels we stayed in Florence and Rome. THis is where we discovered Nutella on toast - awesome. Jeff Carter Fairfax, Virginia, USA

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolinap1
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights it's in a OK location. The Vaporetta stop is called S. Marcola it's a small bridge and a short walk away. It was an easy ride from the Piazza Roma bus station even with luggage. It tends to get a little deserted aound the vaporetta stop after 9:00pm on weekdays. We had a 'double room' that was actually 2 twins pushed together to make a King sized bed, room # 305 facing the street. The hotel is located near the casino, so you can hear people walking and laughing in the street as late as midnight on weekends. But it was comfortable. We had a safe and a mini-fridge. They also have an Elevator. Warning! The bathroom is so small the shower is just a floor with no shower curtain and a hand-held showerhead. So no matter how you try to take a shower it will get all over the floor so be careful! The breakfast was plentiful but plain. They only had cold cereal, yogurt, cresants, and canned fruit cocktail. The expresso was from a push button machine (not the real kind) which was really disappointing. Also they have internet access for $9.00 Euros the week. The hotel is located down the road from a mini-market food store called "COOP", and they have a lot of little stores around.

Reviews.Title: “Room is so nice!”
Reviews.Author: Alexis7
Reviews.Content: Easy to find location in Cannaregio, even from vaporetto station. Room is classic and bathroom is not small. Breakfast room is decorated with murano glass stuff. I would definetly recomend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: jrittenour
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days 4 nights in July 2007. I think we may of had the smallest room in the place but we didn't come to Venice to hang out in our room, so thats ok. The corner room across from us seemed to be a much better size. The bathroom was small but clean. There was no shower curtain which made showering an interesting experience but it worked out. The room was cleared everyday and fresh towels were given each day. The staff was mostly helpful. The breakfast was fine mostly sweet pastries and such. The location was great. Were were able to walk every place we wanted to see and the waterbus stop is just a short walk away. Overall, I would recommend this hotel as a good value for the money. A great place to stay without spending a ton of money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Bradg1998
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel La Forcola for 3 nights at the beginning of August 2007. The hotel is located on a heavily traveled touristy street about 20 minutes (by foot) by the train station. We took the water taxi 2 stops on arrival but walked back when leaving. Everything was as-advertised-- we had a very clean and quiet corner room (small, but clean) on the second floor. The room furnishings were sparse, but more than satisfactory. The bathroom was clean, and with the exception of 1 panel of the shower door being missing, it was fine (there was plenty of hot water). The front desk staff didn't say much to us, but were friendly upon arrival and checkout. Breakfast was fresh and plentiful each morning. The air conditioning worked perfectly. One unusual thing about this hotel is the need to leave your key at the front desk when you leave the property. We've experienced this before at other European hotels, but the front desk always asks for ID (or at least for your name) before giving your key back. This wasn't the case here- we just asked for "Room 206" each afternoon and were promptly given the key. Since this was the case, we were sure to lock up everything of value in the room each day. Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this reasonably priced hotel, and would recommend it to others looking for a clean and simple place for a couple of nights in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: captain_tony
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location was great. Very nice in the morning when the market vendors opened up. The room was clean. The shower was small but where in Italy isn't the shower small. I recommend it highly! Front desk staff was great. We didn't have a reservation and just walked up. We loked being off the beaten path. It wasn't until our last night that we realized the grand canal was only a three minute walk out the front door.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: tonimalone
Reviews.Content: The location was fantastic. We arrived at the train station and took the waterbus two stops and then a very short walk (easy to find) to the hotel. When we left the hotel two days later we walked back to the train station. It really is close enough to walk even if you're dragging a bag or two. The area is perfect for walking everywhere which is what we did. We loved how clean the hotel was, the staff were very helpful, everything was just great. We found great restaurants close by and totally recommend this place for all kinds of travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful receptionist”
Reviews.Author: musicgoose
Reviews.Content: Micale, our hotel receptionist, was very helpful and she spoke English. The other receptionists don't speak as much English. The hotel was very clean and comfortable with one important drawback. Don't take room number 305, which was our room. It does not have a decent shower or even a shower curtain. Our friends stayed in room number 107 and had both a bath tub and a shower with a shower curtain. The breakfast that is included was very good with freshly baked items and plenty to eat and drink. Across from the hotel is a small take-out pizza place with drinks and the best ice cream. It's better than the restaurant nearby. The Riato bridge and St. Mark's square is about a 20 minute walk from the hotel and 10 minutes from the train station. Don't take too much baggage since you need to walk over cobblestones and stairs from the bus boat. The best shopping is at the Rialto bridge, with much better prices than Murano Island, the glass factorY. Leave room in your luggage for souvenirs. Make sure you include time in the evening for a great concert near St. Mark's square. You'll find the brochures at your hotel. If you take an overnight train to Venice, don't accept a "couchette" unless you like camping out on a cot with strangers. Pay the extra for a private room with a good bed. Be sure to order your Orange Pass for Venice transportation, museums, etc. before you go. There's no other city like Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: parneesha211
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my wife and kid. The location was good walking distance to station and vaporetti stop. And since its located on main street its very easy to find. There is a pizzeria right in front of it where one can have their meal. The room and bathroom was spacious. However there was some mould in the bathroom which did not affect us much as we were there only for 2 nights. The other problem was the A/c was not working properly..it was heating even when we turned it to cool. There was a lot of variety in breakfast provided and was in good quantity. However they were very strict about the breakfast timings and even if one is eating at the time of their closing..they start packing up and one is literally forced to finish up fast or leave the rest of it. They could have been a little relaxed about it since its not easy to get up early after a tiring day before and specially with a small child. But overall its a good hotel besides these minor hiccups rest everything was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: mbpeik
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel La Forcola 4 nights during our trip to the Venice region. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. Staff was nice enough, but not overly friendly. The room we stayed in was small, but we were still able to move around quite well. We requested a balcony and recieved one on the canal side. The bathroom was quite small, especially the shower, but it felt great after the long trip from the U.S. ( reguardless of the amount of water on the floor!). Breakfast was good (croissants, cake, yogurt, cereal, coffee, juice, water, nutella, jam...). Overall it was a nice stay and would book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller-Bajan
Reviews.Content: La Forcola is in a great location. We arrived by train and could easily walk with our luggage. Fortunately for us the bridges we had to cross were small or had a ramp. There are stores, restaurants and supermarkets close by. In the hotel, we found the staff to be helpful and the room was clean. However as mentioned by other reviewers the room is small. We booked a double room with a roll away bed and it was tight!! Also, the toilet and shower sharing the same space is not the greatest. You have to keep the toilet seat up when showering. We did ask for a bath mat and they gave us something we could use to create a dry pathway for the toilet. Venice is a great city; in fact it is our favourite place in Italy. The people there were friendly and generally helpful. The streets are great for walking around. If you are looking for a clean, centrally located and budget priced hotel, then La Forcola is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Venice was our first time out of the U.S. so we didn't know what we should expect in a hotel room. However, we loved this hotel. The room was definitley small (we only had a bed and table in our room), but we had a balcony and it added to the ambiance. It really felt like part of the Venice experience. Everything in Venice was so expensive, but we found a supermarket a few blocks away and we were able to find snacks there (and the wine is very cheap!). We caught a shuttle to Venice from the airport and then walked to the hotel from where we were dropped off. My husband and I only had one cary-on luggage each so it wasn't too bad walking to the hotel, but if you plan on bringing more than that, it may be a struggle. The train station is a very short walk from the hotel and definitley do-able with luggage. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Try somwhere else next time”
Reviews.Author: Tripadvisor Sunderland
Reviews.Content: La Forcola is in an excellent position. Ten minutes from the railway station, three minutes from a water bus stop and in the middle of a busy street which has lots of interesting shops, bars and restaurants. On arrival at the hotel, my friend and I were shown to a double room even though we had booked a twin room. After pointing this out at reception a maid was there in minutes to remake the room into a twin room. The room was a reasonable size, quite nice furniture but the walls were tatty and needed a coat of paint. There was a safe, fridge and air conditioning. The bathroom was long and narrow but had no form of shower curtain screen which meant that when one person had a shower, the second person had to paddle through the water to have their shower. The shower was opposite the toilet which resulted in a soaking and dripping wet toilet every time the shower was used. The shower tray had lots of black mould around it which was quite off putting. There were no drinking cups for teeth washing. Our first day in Venice was warm and sunny but the temperature plummeted at night. My friend and I were so cold we couldn't sleep. The air conditioning was on but would not give out any heat and even when we tried to turn this off it still remained freezing cold. We asked at reception next morning for two drinking cups and extra blankets. Breakfast was quite basic â€“ bread, tinned fruit salad, machine produced tea and coffee and croissants. On return to hotel after a dayâ€™s sight seeing, we still had no extra blankets or drinking cups. We asked again before an evening of sightseeing. On return to the hotel, we asked for our spare blankets which we were promised would be at reception. The man on reception explained they had none and we would just have to shut off the air conditioning! There was a guest in reception (11.30pm) sitting in reception wrapped in a blanket who appeared to be giving the reception manager hassle who was wrapped in a blanket. Perhaps he was cold too! Perhaps he had the one spare hotel blanket! On checking out, we expressed our concerns about lack of bedding to be told that as it was now summer all the spare blankets were being washed! We were not very impressed with the staff throughout the stay. The hotel is quite good value for central Venice bit I think we would try somewhere else if we went back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - small rooms!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Venice and we spent 2 nights at the La Forcola Hotel. The hotel is very clean and in a great location. You are slightly off the beaten path (not as many tourists around there), but in walking distance to all the sites, restaurants, etc. The breakfast was nice and the dining area and service was wonderful. The only complaint I have is that our room (we booked a double) was tiny. The bed took up about 90% of the room so we had to squeeze around the room to do anything. Also, the bathroom was tiny too and the shower was in a corner with no shower curtain -- this inevitably led to a flash flood environment after each shower. Overall, the location and cleanliness of the hotel outshined the size issue. I would suggest young couples with no kids for staying at this hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel La Forcola
HotelInfo.Address: Cannaregio 2353, 30121 Venice, Italy
